intro: Isachne brixhii, commonly known as the Brixham sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often found in temperate regions. The plant has slender, triangular stems and produces small, spike-like clusters of flowers. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, with a distinct midrib. Isachne brixhii plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland environments and supports local biodiversity.
